The Master regulates cold and heat, harmonizing the constructive and defensive qi,
robed in cinnabar brocade and draped in jade gauze.
Golden bells and vermilion sashes sway as he sits in dance,
regulating blood and governing life—his body never withers.
Externally, the mouth and tongue emit the Five Flowers;
when near death, calling upon him brings revival.
Practiced long, one soars upon the Great Rosy Clouds.

The attendant burns the talismans for generating the liver and gallbladder.

The High Priest recites silently:
Within the Liver’s Dragon Abyss Lord, styled Harmonious Luminance, overseer,
and Ding Qianshan, the General of the Three Qi of the Primordial Chaos.
The Gallbladder’s Dragon Radiance Lord, styled Majestic Luminance, overseer,
and Shen Fu, the General of the Eight Malevolent Qi of the Primordial Chaos.

Visualize the celestial qi of the Eastern Wood within the Mao character of the dawn script,
swallowed into the cinnabar field, blending with the qi of the liver and gallbladder.
*Silently recite, then exhale with a "xu" sound*—one qi, eight repetitions, blown upon the departed soul,
transforming and generating the liver and gallbladder.

The High Priest recites silently:
Within the Palace of the Liver’s Domain, layers of jadeite enfold,
beneath which dwells a youth, the Azure Lad.
He governs the myriad barriers, the origin of clarity and wisdom,
clad in azure brocade and girded with jade bells.
Harmonizing the hun and po, balancing the fluids,
externally corresponding to the eyes and the essence of sun and moon.
The hundred ailments that afflict him dissolve into the Wuying,
practiced for seven days, they naturally overflow.
At the brink of death, invoke the spirit—life returns;
gathering the hun and returning the po, never to falter.

The attendant burns the talismans for generating the lungs and large intestine.

The High Priest recites silently:
The Lung’s Radiant Flower Lord, styled Void Perfection, overseer,
and Chen Zhiyuan, the General of the Four Qi of the Primordial Chaos.
The Large Intestine’s Primordial King Lord, styled Governance and Harmony, overseer,
and Zhou Ziran, the General of the Nine Qi of the Primordial Chaos.

Visualize the celestial qi of the Western Metal within the You character of the dusk script,
swallowed into the cinnabar field, blending with the qi of the lungs and large intestine.
*Silently recite, then exhale with a "si" sound*—one qi, nine repetitions, blown upon the departed soul,
generating the lungs and large intestine.

The High Priest recites silently:
Within the Palace of the Lung’s Domain, like a flowered canopy,
beneath which sits a youth at the Jade Barrier.
The Seven Origins’ Lad governs the regulation of qi,
externally corresponding to the Central Peak and the nose’s central position.
Clad in plain brocade and a yellow cloud sash,
when breath is labored and the body unwell,
hastily invoke the White Prime to harmonize the Six Qi—
the immortal’s long gaze knows no calamity.
Practiced without cease, the form never stagnates.

The attendant burns the talismans for generating the spleen and stomach.

The High Priest recites silently:
The Spleen’s Ever-Present Lord, styled Peaceful Abode, overseer,
and Wang Xianzhi, the General of the Five Qi of the Primordial Chaos.
The Stomach’s Numinous Source Lord, styled Great Granary, overseer,
and Zhang Xiu, the General of the Ten Qi of the Primordial Chaos.

Visualize the celestial qi of the Central Earth within the Earth script,
swallowed into the cinnabar field, blending with the qi of the spleen and stomach.
*Silently recite the Numinous Treasure incantation*—one qi, ten repetitions, exhaled upon the departed soul,
generating the spleen and stomach.

The High Priest recites silently:
The Palace of the Spleen’s Domain belongs to Wu and Ji,
within which a luminous youth is wrapped in yellow robes.
He disperses grain and scatters qi, governing the teeth,
the Great Granary’s Two Luminous Lads.
Seated within the ninefold golden terrace,
a square inch at the Gate of Life.
He regulates the hundred grains and the five fragrant flavors,
warding off emaciation and illness.
Externally corresponding to the complexion of the wrist’s abode,
the radiance thus generated manifests.
Clad in yellow brocade and jade robes, girded with tiger talismans,
invoke the Three Elders—lightly soaring.
Long life and high immortality, far from the calamity of death.

The attendant burns the talismans for generating the Triple Burner, heart, and pericardium.

The High Priest recites silently:
The Triple Burner’s Arrayed Spirits Lord, styled Mystic Fluid, overseer,
and Wang Zhuoli, the General of the Eleven Qi of the Primordial Chaos.
The Pericardium’s Vermilion Pearl Lord, styled Numinous Motion, overseer,
and Zheng Ming, the General of the Twelve Qi of the Primordial Chaos.

Visualize the celestial qi of the Central Palace within the Earth script,
the Three Colors—azure, white, and yellow—swallowed into the cinnabar field,
blending with the pericardium, Triple Burner, and heart.
The qi of the body’s nodes and hundred vessels,
blown upon the departed soul,
generating the Triple Burner, pericardium, heart, nodes, and hundred vessels.

The Primordial nurtures form and spirit,
governing the northeast quarter.
Heaven’s brightness governs the yang qi,
transforming and generating the Triple Burner.
The Primordial’s singular qi-spirit,
governing the northwest and Qian directions.
Heaven’s brightness governs the true qi,
nurturing and completing the pericardium.

The attendant burns the talisman for completing the entire form.

The High Priest, with his left hand holding the Jade Script, draws the true qi of the Five Directions—twelve breaths—
swallowed into a single spirit-form, like an infant,
clad in white rosy clouds, a halo crowning its neck,
the spirit radiating auspicious light,
descending to suffuse the entire form,
dispersing into the nine orifices, gathering at the tongue’s tip, then blown forth.
The departed soul’s entire body—five viscera, six bowels, four limbs, and hundred vessels—is now complete.

All recite:
The Supreme Peerless, soaring upon the Nine Origins’ radiance,
congealing essence and condensing qi, transforming form and transmuting spirit.
The Controller of Life blends and unites, scattering form into myriad parts.
A thousand chariots of fiery armor, ten thousand riders with fluttering banners,
all join with the Great One, ascending to become Imperial Immortals.
Bo Wu rises without error, Zhong Cheng bends to the script.
First, unite with my qi; second, unite with my spirit;
third, unite with my hun; fourth, unite with my po;
fifth, unite with my purity; sixth, unite with my form.
The sixfold union completes the body, the cavernous rosy clouds reveal the true.
The Eight Effulgences’ empty chariot, the Three Simplicities’ floating wheel—
I and the Imperial One together ascend to the Jade Palace.
Layered blossoms and branching stems, blending with the Heavenly Immortals.
The body holds the Dao’s register, the world has its root of life.
Golden tablets and feathered talismans, names inscribed upon the Solar Chariot.
Wishes fulfilled, celestial blessings flow abundantly.
Desires manifest, myriad spirits fill the gate.
Ever abide with the Great One, the Imperial One at the Mud-Pill Palace.
Yin and yang blend, a hundred spirits entwine.
Recite the scripture ten thousand times, the numinous chariot comes to welcome.
Feasting with the Five Emperors, the Nine Lords of Sun and Moon,
attaining immortality as an Upper Clarity Perfected.
Envision the departed soul’s form—now complete.

All recite again:
The Dragon Han vast and boundless, formless and nameless,
stretching across countless eons, the Yellow Dao shines forth.
Spirits clear and luminous, the Nine Hun emit their essence.
The Jade Void gleams, the Great Rosy Clouds rise high.
The Primordial begins transformation, all heavens unite as one.
The Three Origins’ Dao-qi, the Two Images gather life.
Those already delivered are delivered, those unformed are formed.
The dead are revived, the withered made flourishing.

The Six Jia circulate, the Five Phases interact,

Five Spirits Blending with Heaven Honored One.

chunks.original_text: 道言戒者，止也。 所以止人非心，归於正定，故戒生定。 儒者亦谓，知止而后有定，但三洞诸经，四部秘典，说戒法，种种不同。 惟无上灵宝九真妙戒之旨，天人共仰，幽显咸遵。 无上之上，洞玄之玄，万神之灵，一炁之宝，妙贯三才，戒制六情，数定於阳，故分於九，修而不伪，故名为真。 凡世仰之，以为城廓； 幽显资之，以为梯航； 灵魂受之，以为法药。 然受戒之法，静默为先； 持戒之功，勤拳为上。 法众皈依，同诚赞咏。 知磬举 按人各众和恭敬 夫三#5皈依者，即为皈依道，皈依经，皈依师也。 是故众魂，皆当信礼。 第一皈依无上道宝，举道宝天尊。 第二皈依无上经宝，举经宝天尊。 第三皈依无上师宝，举师宝天尊。 皈依既毕，戒法将传，幽壤豁若春回，冤对涣然永释。 罪花凋落，功果圆成。 法众虔诚，宣传九戒： 第一戒者，克勤忠於君王。 第二戒者，敬让孝养父母。 第三戒者，不杀慈救众生。 第四戒者，不淫正身处物。 第五戒者，不盗推义损己。 第六戒者，不嗔凶怒凌人。 第七戒者，不诈谄贼害善。 第八戒者，不骄傲忽至真。 第九戒者，不二奉戒专一。 如上九戒，乃九天帝君，亲口宣说。 佩奉者，升入九天； 轻慢者，堕入九地。 今对亡灵，依科传受，切宜谛听，终始勿忘。 所有功德符箓，逐一宣示。 表白宣长生符，生天箓 妙戒灵文，黄箓白简，既备敷於妙典，当敬奉于灵文。 夫心之难制，故九戒则可归心於太虚； 形也未超，以二符则可炼形於上境。 亡灵直斯，生生勿忘於戒言，劫劫常存於符券。 澄神物外，尘缘永断於多生； 受质阳间，善果自臻于妙有。 流芳现在，庆及无穷。 少顷发遣，保举登仙。 高功遣将 某司谨召九天普度院、守雄抱雌二大将，本坛主将副将，护道监坛四大元帅，疾速部卫，亡某径诣朱陵火府、南昌上宫。 上帝有敕，风火无停 举 宝华圆满天尊 汝等亡魂某腾光南极，离暗北酆。 礼道、礼经、礼师，一真日皎； 炼形、炼神、炼炁，万妄风清。 兹登寥廓之乡，径达虚无之境，永脱轮转，自在逍遥，辞筵好去，毋忘道恩。 知声举 超凌仙界天尊

The Dao speaks: "Precepts are restraint." They restrain the human mind from wrongdoing, guiding it to true stillness—thus precepts give rise to stillness. The Confucians also say, "Knowing restraint, one attains stillness." Yet among the Three Caverns' scriptures and the Four Divisions' secret texts, the methods of precepts vary widely. Only the sublime and wondrous Nine True Precepts of the Supreme Numinous Treasure command the reverence of heaven and humanity, observed alike by the hidden and the manifest. Supreme above all that is supreme, profound beyond all that is profound, numinous among the ten thousand spirits, precious as the singular *qi*—their marvel pervades the Three Realms, their precepts govern the Six Passions. Their number is fixed by yang, hence divided into nine; cultivated without falsity, they are called "true." The world looks up to them as its fortress; the hidden and manifest rely on them as their bridge; souls receive them as their healing medicine.

The method of receiving precepts begins with stillness and silence; the practice of upholding them demands utmost diligence. The assembly bows in reverence, joining in sincere praise.

At the sounding of the chime:
*Let each in the assembly respond with reverence.*

The Three Refuges are refuge in the Dao, refuge in the scriptures, and refuge in the masters. Therefore, all souls must believe and pay homage.

First, take refuge in the Supreme Treasure of the Dao:
*Heavenly Worthy of the Treasure of the Dao.*

Second, take refuge in the Supreme Treasure of the Scriptures:
*Heavenly Worthy of the Treasure of the Scriptures.*

Third, take refuge in the Supreme Treasure of the Masters:
*Heavenly Worthy of the Treasure of the Masters.*

With the Refuges complete, the transmission of precepts begins. The dark netherworld brightens like spring’s return; karmic debts dissolve forever. The flowers of sin wither; merit and fruition come to perfect fulfillment. The assembly, with utmost devotion, proclaims the Nine Precepts:

The First Precept: Be diligent and loyal to the sovereign.
The Second Precept: Honor and humbly serve your parents.
The Third Precept: Do not kill; show compassion to all beings.
The Fourth Precept: Do not commit sexual misconduct; maintain purity in body and conduct.
The Fifth Precept: Do not steal; practice righteousness and self-restraint.
The Sixth Precept: Do not harbor anger or bully others.
The Seventh Precept: Do not deceive or harm the virtuous.
The Eighth Precept: Do not be arrogant or neglect the true.
The Ninth Precept: Do not waver; uphold the precepts with single-minded devotion.

These Nine Precepts were personally proclaimed by the Nine Heavenly Lords. Those who wear and honor them ascend to the Nine Heavens; those who slight them fall into the Nine Hells. Today, in accordance with the rites, they are transmitted to the departed souls. Listen carefully and never forget from beginning to end.

All talismans of merit are displayed one by one:
The *Announcer* presents the *Talisman of Longevity* and the *Register of Ascension to Heaven*.
The wondrous precepts and numinous texts, the Yellow Register and White Tablet, having been set forth in the sacred scriptures, are now reverently offered to the spirits.

The heart is hard to govern—thus the Nine Precepts return it to the Great Void. The form has not yet transcended—thus the two talismans refine it in the celestial realms. Departed souls, never forget these precepts in any lifetime; keep these talismans close through every kalpa. With spirit settled beyond the material world, the dusty bonds of many lives are forever severed. Reborn in the yang realm, the fruits of goodness naturally ripen in wondrous being. Your virtue shines in the present, bringing boundless blessings. Soon, the souls will be dispatched, protected and guided to ascend as immortals.

The High Priest dispatches the generals:
*[Such-and-such] Office respectfully summons the Nine Heavens’ Universal Salvation Court, the Two Great Generals Guarding the Male and Embracing the Female, the principal and deputy generals of this altar, the Four Great Marshals protecting the Dao and overseeing the altar—hasten to escort the departed soul of [Name] directly to the Vermilion Numinous Fire Palace and the Southern Prosperity Upper Palace. By the Emperor’s decree, wind and fire shall not delay.*

All recite:
*Heavenly Worthy of Perfect Flowering Completion.*

Departed souls, you now soar toward the Southern Culmen, leaving the darkness of the Northern Feng. Having paid homage to the Dao, the scriptures, and the masters, the sun of singular truth shines bright. Refining form, spirit, and *qi*, the winds of ten thousand illusions are stilled. You ascend to the vast and boundless realm, reaching the realm of emptiness and non-being. Forever freed from the wheel of rebirth, you abide in effortless freedom. Depart now from this feast; do not forget the grace of the Dao.

At the sounding of the voice:
*Heavenly Worthy Who Transcends the Immortal Realms.*
